ada_hub.lib.ada_sense package¶

Module contents¶

class ada_hub.lib.ada_sense.AdaSense(config)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class that handles interaction between the APP and the Sense device.

add_to_config()[source]¶

A function that adds the SENSE and SENSE_DEVICE sections to the config file. Should be rare to use this as the config class should have created these sections already.

Returns

ConfigParser object modified.

change_temp_scale(new_scale)[source]¶

Change the scale that temperature results will be delivered in moving forward.

Call on this function to change the scale that temperature results are delivered in, going forward. Part of the processes run by this function are to check the string provided by the new_scale parameter of this function.

Parameters

() (new_scale) –

Returns

None

load_sense(emulate=False)[source]¶

Load the Sense device interface

Parameters

emulate (bool) – Should the Sense emulator be loaded? True for yes, False for no (default)

Returns:

log_name¶

The name of the logger for this class

Type

str

sense¶

An instance of SenseHat()

This is either going to be one of two objects:

sense_hat.SenseHat()

This will be returned when the program detects that it is connected to a Sense Hat and all the proper packages are installed. This will be the most often initialized class given that the application will most-often be used in a production environment.

sense_emu.SenseHat()

If the program was explicitly instructed to (using the ‘–emulate’ flag) or, if the program has had an issue connecting to/finding the actual Sense Hat hardware it will start Sense Emu which is SenseHat emulation software to assist in testing and development

Note

You can ensure the emulator always/never starts by manipulating the respective option in the config file!

ada_hub.lib.ada_sense.VALID_TEMP_SCALES = ['c', 'celsius', 'f', 'fahrenheit', 'k']¶

The strings that will be accepted by the program as valid temp scales to check against when assigning/changing the respective option.
